page.title: 02Ecology of Evie
page.content: MOORLAND: The main plant is heather sprinkled with cotton grasses and rushes. Two small insectivorous plants found are{SunDew}and{Butterwort In this part of Evie there is a stretch of water called{Looma Shun meaning 'lake of the{Red-Throated {Divers'.}Here there are 2 pair nesting but they fly to the shore to feed on fish. {Grouse}breed here among long heather while{Golden Plover}prefer short heather. Here too are found the {Meadow Pippit}and{Short-Eared Owl (Catty Face). A very common bird is the{Curlew}which nests on moorland but feeds on farmland, while the{Hen {Harrier,}quite a rare bird, finds this area congenial. Two birds which are seldom found in moorland but nest here are{Wood Pigeons}and{Starlings,}the later using old rabbit holes. The{Orkney Vole}tunnels in heather.
